channel.title: Need help with getting a no-ip
channel.description: ok, ive signed up from www.no-ip.com, and tried to make a no-ip host name. It all worked except 1 little thing, everytime i try to make it work, this sentence in red pops up saying "The host you entered is invalid" does that mean the name of my host is invalid? or the type..if its the type, what type are we supposed to use?

item.title: Need help with getting a no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Killed_By_Squirrel Killed By Squirrel
item.description:
@Killed_By_Squirrel wrote:

lol gangsta:

oh , i understand now. ok guys, thanks a lot!

He didn’t do anything but copy my post, which you’re not aloud to do. No posts pertaining “i agree”, or no posts repeating anything, things only need to be said once.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with getting a no-ip
item.dc:creator: @Killed_By_Squirrel Killed By Squirrel
item.description:
@Killed_By_Squirrel wrote:

[quote=“musicmad441, post:4, topic:111668”]i no your problem!

when you type the host name in box dont add the “.” the dot at the end etc:

if you wanted ownage.no-ip.org you just type ownage in the box instead of ownage.

Hope that helped James.[/quote]
If that’s the answer to your question, great. But if its not, please post a pic.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with getting a no-ip
item.dc:creator: @lol_gangsta lol gangsta
item.description:
@lol_gangsta wrote:

ok, i will explain more clearly, i have been trying to make a no-ip host. I use the host type called “dNs host (a)” im not sure what to do with the bottom section of the application to make the host. So i skipped it. I then clicked “create host” (which means in a childs way of saying it:i try to make it work) the sentence “the host you entered is invalid” pops up at the top of the host type. Is this the host i should be using?

Read full topic
